1.SceneDescription: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is balancing a mini hockey stick on his hand asNEWLINEChandler enters from his room carrying a bunch of bills.

lines.Line: (watches Joey for a moment) Okay! (Joey quickly moves the hockey stickNEWLINEso that he’s scratching his back with it.) Listen, I’m gonna be moving out so youNEWLINEwill be in charge of paying the rent
Right! And when is that due
Right! And when is that due
No, just the months you actually want to live here
Okay, here is the phone bill. (Hands it to Joey.
That’s our phone number. Now look, I know I kinda sprung thisNEWLINEwhole me moving out on thing, so why don’t I just—why don’t I just coverNEWLINEyou for a while
No-no! No way! Joey Tribbiani does not take charity…anymore
No-no! No way! Joey Tribbiani does not take charity…anymore
No! Forget it! Okay—I mean thanks, but I’m done taking moneyNEWLINEfrom you. All right, I can take of myself. Now, what’s next? Come on
Okay uh, here’s the electric bill. (Hands it to him.
Okay uh, here’s the electric bill. (Hands it to him.
This is how much we pay for electric?!!

lines.Character: (Joey runs over and shuts off the lights
lines.Line: Joey runs over and shuts off the lights.
So, we’ll do the rest of the bills later then

2.SceneDescription: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is entering carrying two pizzas.

lines.Line: Here it is! Our last pizzas together as roommates
Oh, I wish I’d know you were going to do that, I ordered Chinese
Oh that’s okay. Hey, actually in a way it’s kinda nice. Me,NEWLINEbringing the food of my ancestors, you, the food of yours

lines.Character: (Chandler stares at him, dumbfounded, then finally agrees
lines.Line: Chandler stares at him, dumbfounded, then finally agrees.

lines.Character: (Chandler stares at him, dumbfounded, then finally agrees
lines.Line: Chandler stares at him, dumbfounded, then finally agrees.
Say, Joe, I had a strange idea of what we could do for our last night.NEWLINEWhat do you say we play a little uh, foosball for money
What, are you crazy? You haven’t beaten me once since my injuryNEWLINEplagued ’97 season. It would be easier if you just give me your money
Yes it would. What do you say to $50
Yes it would. What do you say to $50
Yes it would. What do you say to $50
Okay, let’s play! The big game, Italy vs. China, apparently

3.SceneDescription: Chandler and Joey's, they are just finishing up another game of foosball.

lines.Line: (scores) Yes! I win again! Ha-ha! That’s like 500 bucks you owe me!NEWLINEWhoo-ho-hoo! (Goes over to the fridge and starts opening and closing the door rapidly.)NEWLINE$500 that is a loooot of electricity! (By the way, there’s nothing in the fridge.)NEWLINEWhoo-ho-ho! (Notices the sparseness of the fridge.) I gotta buy some food
Okay, give me a chance to win my money back. Okay? Sudden death, oneNEWLINEgoal, $1,000
Okay, get ready to owe me
Okay, get ready to owe me

lines.Character: [In slow motion, as some haunty demonic music plays in the background, Joey throws theNEWLINEball in, Chandler quits playing and goes for his Chinese food. Joey smacks the ball reallyNEWLINEhard, shooting it down the table. Chandler slowly takes a bite, the ball bounces off ofNEWLINEthe wall, heads back up the table, and scores the goal for Chandler
lines.Line: In slow motion, as some haunty demonic music plays in the background, Joey throws theNEWLINEball in, Chandler quits playing and goes for his Chinese food. Joey smacks the ball reallyNEWLINEhard, shooting it down the table. Chandler slowly takes a bite, the ball bounces off ofNEWLINEthe wall, heads back up the table, and scores the goal for Chandler.
No! No! No! No—(Joey looks at him)—one can beat me

lines.Character: (In frustration, Joey kicks the table, breaking it
lines.Line: In frustration, Joey kicks the table, breaking it.

lines.Character: (In frustration, Joey kicks the table, breaking it
lines.Line: In frustration, Joey kicks the table, breaking it.
See? Now, that’s why only the little fake men are supposed to doNEWLINEall the kicking

4.SceneDescription: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel is entering carrying two glasses of wine. SheNEWLINEgives one to Phoebe, keeps one, and completely ignores Monica.

lines.Line: Yeah, I think it was better when you guys were sad. Hey, uh, rememberNEWLINEthe roller blades
You know what else I’m not gonna miss? I’m Monica. INEWLINEwash the toilet 17 times a day. Even if people are on it
Hi I’m Rachel, is my sweater too tight? No? Oh, I’dNEWLINEbetter wash it and shrink it
I’m Monica, I don’t get phone messages from interestingNEWLINEpeople. Ever
I’m Monica, I don’t get phone messages from interestingNEWLINEpeople. Ever
Oh my God, I love Ross! I hate Ross! I love Ross! I hateNEWLINERoss
Oh my God, I can’t find a boyfriend! So I guess I’llNEWLINEjust stumble across the hall and sleep with the first guy I find in there

lines.Character: (Monica picks up one of those boxes of hair curling things, dumps it in a box, andNEWLINEstorms out
lines.Line: Monica picks up one of those boxes of hair curling things, dumps it in a box, andNEWLINEstorms out.
Yeah, we should get a move on if we wanna make those dinnerNEWLINEreservations. (Phoebe dumps a drawer full of makeup into a box.

5.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is whining to Phoebe about Rachel.

lines.Line: Well, one of you has to take the first step! And it should be you,NEWLINEbecause she’s the one who’s leaving. It’s harder for her
Well, maybe you’re right—She made fun of my phone pen
Well, maybe you’re right—She made fun of my phone pen
I know, I took it hard too
I know, I took it hard too
Listen Rachel, I feel really bad about—What are you doing? (SheNEWLINEsees that Rachel is unpacking.
I’m not moving! (She re-hangs a picture, crookedly.) Is thatNEWLINEpicture straight
It needs to go about 20 blocks to the left
It needs to go about 20 blocks to the left
Hey, y’know what? You’re the one who wants to make this bigNEWLINEchange and move in with Chandler! You should be the one to go! Why should I have toNEWLINEleave?
Well it’s mine too! What else you got?

How about, you’re moving!! (Grabs a bunch of clothes and throwsNEWLINEthem into a box. What follows is a brief sequence of Rachel unpacking and Monica packingNEWLINEthe same stuff over and over again as Rachel chants No. and Monica chantsNEWLINEYes.
Look! This is ridiculous. We should be packing you!! (She knocks overNEWLINEMonica, grabs a box, and runs into the kitchen.
Hey, how are you guys doing
Hey, how are you guys doing
Hey, how are you guys doing
Hey, how are you guys doing
Oh really?! Then how come all your stuff is in this box?! (Monica startsNEWLINEchasing Rachel around the table.

Okay, you guys. You guys I think I know what’s going on here. Okay,NEWLINEyou guys… STOP!! (They stop.) I know that, I know that you’reNEWLINEacting mad because you think that it’ll make it easier to leave. But deep downNEWLINEyou’re still really sad. Deep-deep down
Then keep running. (They resume the chase.

6.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, Monica carries a box out of Rachel’s room.

lines.Line: Well, this is the last box of your clothes. I’m just gonna labelNEWLINEit, What were you thinking
Funny, because I was just gonna go across the hall and write that onNEWLINEChandler
Hey you guys, I don’t mean to make things worse, but umm, INEWLINEdon’t want to live with Rachel anymore
You’re just so mean to each other! And I don’t want to end upNEWLINElike that with Rachel. I still like you
Well, Phoebe that’s fine because I’m not moving
Well, Phoebe that’s fine because I’m not moving
Whoa-whoa-whoa, Phoebe you gotta take her! Y’know I-I-I said someNEWLINEreally bad stuff about her, but y’know Rachel has some good qualities thatNEWLINEmake her a good roommate
Y’know she has 147,000 pairs of boots
Yeah and you stretch ‘em out with your big old clown feet
Do you wanna live outside?! Because it’s gettin’ cold! (ToNEWLINEPhoebe) She gets tons of catalogs and umm, she’ll fold down the pages of the thingsNEWLINEshe thinks that I’d like
When I take a shower, she leaves me little notes on the mirror
Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that
Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that
Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that
That’s nice. I like having things to read in the bathroom
When I fall asleep on the couch after reading, she covers me over with aNEWLINEblanket
Well y’know, I don’t want you to be cold
Well y’know, I don’t want you to be cold

And when I told her that I was gonna be moving in with Chandler, she wasNEWLINEreally supportive. (To Rachel) (Starts to cry) You were so great. You made it so easy. AndNEWLINEnow you have to leave. And I have to live with a boy!! (They both break down in tears.
Okay Rachel, I can’t wait to live with you! And you knowNEWLINEwhat we should do? Bring Monica and then we could all live there together! We’ll haveNEWLINEso much fun!
But honey, I think she’s moving in with Chandler
But honey, I think she’s moving in with Chandler
Oh that’s right. You’re still set on that
Kinda. (She hugs Phoebe and looks out the window. She moves closer to itNEWLINEto get a better look.) Oh my God

lines.Character: [Cut to Ross’s apartment, he’s watching TV and eating some popcorn as theNEWLINEphone rings
lines.Line: Cut to Ross’s apartment, he’s watching TV and eating some popcorn as theNEWLINEphone rings.

lines.Character: [Cut to Ross’s apartment, he’s watching TV and eating some popcorn as theNEWLINEphone rings
lines.Line: Cut to Ross’s apartment, he’s watching TV and eating some popcorn as theNEWLINEphone rings.

(answering the phone) Hello? (Listens) Hey Mon, how’s the packingNEWLINEgoing? (Listens) Ben? He’s fine. Yeah, he’s right—Oh my God! (He looks overNEWLINEat the fake Ben and notices that the head has fallen off.) Get your head of your shirtNEWLINEthere son! (He tries to push the pumpkin through the neck hole.) What? (Listens) Yeah,NEWLINEit’s a pumpkin. I’ll come pack

7.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, (And that’s the last time for that line, no moreNEWLINEChandler and Joey’s or Monica and Rachel’s, ever!) Joey and Ross are carryingNEWLINEthe last table of Rachel’s. Rachel follows slowly, but is stopped by Monica.

lines.Line: Hey. Call me when you get there. Okay
Oh! I have your key. Here you go. (Hands it to Monica.
Oh God! This is silly, I’m gonna see you in a couple of hours!NEWLINE(They hug again.)

lines.Character: (Monica closes the door and slowly walks into Rachel’s old and now empty room
lines.Line: Monica closes the door and slowly walks into Rachel’s old and now empty room.
No problem roomie. (She turns around and hugs him.
Can I ask you a question
Can I ask you a question
Can I ask you a question
What the hell is that dog doing here?! (She notices the dogNEWLINEsitting in the living room.
